text:
Haven't yet tried this Oyster Bar in Santa Fe....because unlike Texas Station, this one doesn't open until 4 or 5 pm.  

Hey!!! F & B Manager....people love fish for LUNCH too!!

Excellent food and amazing service whether it's jam packed or just a few locals. The serve staff are what keep us coming back. They are always smiling, joking and my water glass never gets empty when I order an extra spicy dinner.

***dinner on a weekday*** 

Been a fan of palace stations oyster bar n am super shocked that its been really popular the past few years. I dont wanna wait over an hr for the oyster bar anymore n make the trip to the strip as often as i'd like so i was super excited to hear that santa fe station, which is like literally down the street from my house, is opening up an oyster bar. Ive been to al's oyster bar at orleans, n the oyster bar at harrahs and lemme tell u, its all about palace stations' AND santa fes'!!!!! Becoz santa fes oyster bar uses the same recipe as palace stations its pretty damn close and good.  to boot they hav more room, you get to pick ur oysters *best part*, they hav a few more options on the menu and dessert!! Woohoo!! 

Had my usual for comparison reasons combo pan roast, NE clam chowder, 1/2 dz KUMAMOTO oysters. (u dont get an option at palace station) lemme tell u evrything was AWESUM SAUCE!!! 

Price is the same, no sourdough bread but a garlic toast style texas toast thingy, but they do hav sourdough bread bowls for the soups so im not to butt hurt about them not having the complimentary sourdough bread. Met the Executive chef and the kitchen chef. The staff was great, im def coming back. Nuff said. Njoy!!

I was so exited to visit this place again, to my surprise they closed their doors some six months ago.  They opened a new Sushi place, since i was there  I decided to try it anyway.  Lest just say if you are looking for Sushi you can do better anywhere but this place their prices are high.  The food well its not worth it, i had the gumbo, too slimy, had some sushi well the fish is too fishii(smelly).  Overall eat there only if have to.

Honestly, it wasn't that good and whomever designed the restaurant was an idiot. The line was ridiculously long and my food took over 40 minutes. Service was incredibly poor. However, I would like to point out that the poor service was in no way the fault of the poor girl. I watched her bus tables, take orders, make drinks, deliver food and have to talk to angry people in line. That's way too much for one person to do (mind you there were 3 servers but still get a busser or a host). The restaurant is poorly planned and poorly executed. 

I had the House Gumbo but it was way too salty. My husband had the Fra Diablo and it wasn't even that spicy. The lobster felt rubbery and overcooked in both of our meals. It was just gross and the restaurant was awful. I will never come back here but considering how awful and sloppy the other restaurants at Santa Fe are this comes as no surprise.
Great spot in Santa Fe Casino. Surprised at the quality! Great people, good food close to home.
They were out of several dishes (2 different apps and one dessert). Food was okay, not great. I wouldn't waste my time going there.

We always enjoy the food at the the Oyster Bar.  They have fantastic gumbo and pan roast. Today we had a slight problem with our dish but because of their great customer service they took care of it immediately.  They went above and beyond to make sure we were happy.
And the bread pudding! The bomb!

The service and food was terrible!! The clam chowder was extremely salty, Cesar salad was meh, cioppino lacked flavor!! It tasted like it was made w/ a can of crushed tomatoes, no flavor whatsoever!! There were 4 clams, 2 small mussels, 2 very very small pieces of crab, several pieces of shrimp and no fish!!! When I mentioned it, the waitress, Emily, took the bowl and gave it to guy who prepared it. Then she tried to tell me there was fish in the bowl but "it had broken up" in the preparation as if the fish had disappeared? While she's telling me this, the guy started looking through my bowl she gave him???? The clam and mussels weren't even cooked in the tomato broth, he placed the clam and mussels on top of the bowl after he poured cioppino into the bowl. I know this because I watched him.  It was tasteless!! They should be ashamed of themselves to charge so much, $24! Our waitress didn't provide much attention either, but she sure did to the couple next to us who were platinum members!! Very disappointing experience and would never go back here. Your better off going to Palace Station!

Saw that they were opening the old oyster bar up at Santa fe and decided to check it out.   Used to going to palace stations oyster bar, long wait usually but worth it. Does santa fe compare?   It's close and if you live on that side of town like I do is worth checking out. 

First off,  don't let the prices stop you from coming here.  The portion sizes were more than worth it for me.   

Tried the chicken gumbo,  linguini and clams, mac and cheese, and seafood jambalaya.  Mac and cheese was oh so good. A place that the food comes out hot!

I'm spoiled on good jumbalaya so theirs was respectable.  Nothing like mom's cooking to compare to. ..

Gumbo is my favorite and theirs didn't disappoint.  Good amount of the right spices (level 4!) A tad too much salt for me made drinking those moscow mules even easier.

Linguini and clams, according to my guest, was yummy and worth ordering again.

The fish and chips,  while I didn't order but someone next to me did,  was impressive looking and for how they cleaned the plate must have been good. 

Our server was good and will give the respect that I think the team is new and it just opened and will only get better with each visit.  

Overall good time and will definately go back.

There were very few people at the time my wife and I arrived with the number of seats available at the bar and the table yet it took approximately 20 minutes to seat us.. service is extremely bad and the food is average and over price save yourself some money and frustration eat somewhere else
The gumbo was burnt so I got the linguine with shrimp it was watered down with no flavor. I will not be going back to the place.

Much to my dismay my favorite has gone the way of other casino based restaurants. 

This was a fabulous place with high quality food and tremendous service. We ate here regularly and celebrated many occasions here. On my most recent visit we noticed a distinct quality decline fish was no longer a prime tasty  meal but a low quality greasy cheaper cut. Andouile  Sausage were like cut up Vienna Sausage. Although Emily may still be the best waitress in town there was a lack of team work that I always noticed between all the staff. The manager that seemed to be the glue to the staff by leading by example was also  noticeably absent. My guess is a restaurant "genius" found a way to increase profit by cutting expenses. Its hard to increase profits when your customers leave, like this one!

Wish I could give this place a negative rating, the whole experience was a disaster from the very beginning. Should have went to the food court instead.

Entrance is roped off like a buffet line, had to wait 1 hour for 2 party's of 2 in front of me to be seated. Very limited space, 4 small Denny's style tables. Rest of the seating was cramped bar seats.

Took 15 minutes to place order, 45 minutes for arrival. Elderly couple next to us waited 1 hour for fish and chips.

Lobster Roll was bland.

Dozen oysters were shucked incorrectly, presented on a bowl of ice as if they were an ice sculpture. Poor taste, ultra sandy and gritty.

House Gumbo was crap.

Monkey bread pudding tasted like doughy microwave batter.

Overpriced and over hyped. Will not return, buyer beware. Service and food is terrible.

What a gem!!  We went on a Friday night and there was a singer/guitarist who was wonderful!!!  Wish I had her name.  We did have to wait a bit, not unusual for such a small space but Chef Robbie was incredibly hospitable and charming.  The food was yummy!!!!!

It was me and my husband's first time here and it was amazing! The oysters were so fresh and big! We ordered a dozen and came to the conclusion that we need to come here at least every month to get our ouster fix. He also got the clam linguine and I had a clam chowder sourdough bowl and both were just as good! They were definitely not stingy with the amount of clams and clam meat inside the pasta. We came here on a Tuesday night at around 8 and there was no wait whatsoever. I will definitely stay away from this place during the weekend to avoid the long wait time.

I have to say I was a little disappointed in the food.   The jambalaya was lacking any meat other then the over cooked mussels on top.   It was just mush, but it is also my fault for ordering something that isn't 100 fresh cooked when ordered.   The shrimp cocktail was very good a little to much horseradish but after my first bite I knew to take a little less sauce.    Might try again if it is comped

My review is from a week ago, went there with my spouse for dinner. Our server was Emily- nice+ cheerful lady but wasn't as attentive and needed to be reminded for things hence the 4 stars 
Food was good and portion was huge and deserves 5 stars
The wait was 10 mins at 7 pm which was also a plus.

First off i hate to give bad reviews but as a student of the culinary arts i have to.... everyone in this place need to be fired..... my problem with this place is they got the order right but the food was all wrong i ordered a take out order a house gumbo which a string and a piece of plastic in it then i also ordered 2 house pan roast to which both were watery and completely tasteless and full of shells from the meat one was supposed to be a level 7 heat and the other a 10 heat but both were just nasty to which i had to throw all the food away this is completely unacceptable the order came to over 80 dollars and i shouldn't have had to throw my money in the trash now if all the oyster bars are not going to be modeled after the Palace Station which hands down is #1 then they need to be closed down starting with the one at Sante Fe Station this is just wrong wrong wrong and the executive chef need to be fired first for letting food come out of his kitchen like that....so to for anyone actually reading this take the extra 10 min and go to palace station...DO NOT EAT AT THE SANTA FE OYSTER BAR.....save your money time and gas

Watch out Palace Station, because the Oyster Bar at Santa Fe is to die for. 

The atmosphere of the restaurant has a modern casual feel, with great decor. The staff was very upbeat, friendly, and personable. Overall a great experience and atmosphere. 

Now let's get to the good stuff... The food! 

We ordered a half dozen of oysters to start off with. The great thing, is that you get to pick from their list of oysters, and choose which ones you would like to order. The cost doesn't change, and it's nice to have a variety to try from. We also ordered a bowl of the New England clam chowder. All I can say is that it is heaven. I just wish they had the option to serve it in a bread bowl. However, they give you garlic bread (free of charge) when you sit down. The garlic bread was on point. 

For dinner we ordered the fish and chips, and the lobster, crab, shrimp pan roast. The fish and chips were one of a kind. I have never ate fish and chips that were deep fried whole (of course the skin was taken off and the head of the fish, but they kept the tail on.) The batter was not heavy, and perfectly fried. The fish was very moist and flavorful. The pan roast was epic. It was so flavorful, creamy, and absolutely delicious. 

I would definitely recommend this new spot to everyone! A must try for locals!

The shrimp still had the entrails in it and was tougher than shoe leather. My wife had the fish and chips that tasted like water, and the wine was flat as if they gave us the last of a bottle that had been sitting open all day. The fries were the best part of this meal. Two thumbs down on the food but the staff if friendly and attentive.
Excellent food, staff and atmosphere. Wish I could eat here every night.  I especially like the Monkey Bread Pudding .

Horrible! Horrible! Horrible! Why can't I just give this place zero starts! This has been the third time that we have been here and this place is trash. First off they always take forever on giving you your oysters, we asked for more lemon and when the server came to give them to us she spilled my boyfriends beer all over his hand when we were just enjoying our oysters accidents happen I get , my pan roast was so salty I couldn't even enjoy just asked for it to go just went to the trash anyways , boyfriend ordered shrimp linguine so oily but he said his was edible.while we are trying to eat this food that we are not happy with they sit 3 drunk ladies next to us , one of them was so outta of it she started putting her hand on my boyfriends shoulder , my boyfriend turned around and said are you okay because she was falling asleep when she opened her eyes she asked if I was his wife because she thought I had a problem with it, so she started saying all kinds of crazy stuff I just ignored and than she got up to approach me again and I told her I had no problem , than she began to cursed and walk . One of the other girls that was with her apologized to me said she was bipolar but no she was clearly drunk and they were allowing her to keep drinking outta of that gallon of alcohol they had. The whole time one of the girls was holding the ladies hand so she wouldn't fall .    my boyfriend and I looked down by where they are sitting and they have a gallon with alcohol the lady was trying to reach over to have more drink how does this place allow this people in here , no one said anything all the servers just watched this drunk lady and the other 2 girls trying to help but they were all drunk . This was the icing to the cake. I will never be back to this place and will make sure I don't recommend it to anyone. Please people do yourself a favor and go wait at palace station or even Texas station oyster bar has better service and food!

My wife and I live in Vegas, and often eat out at local establishments. We live only a few miles from Santa Fe Station, and wanted to try the "oyster bar," which is one of the Resturants in the casino. Touted as a resturant favorite is their fish and chips, so, that is what we tried. The dish looked great' however, what destroyed this meal was the service-it was the worst I've encountered in Las Vegas in 6 years. To begin, the resturant was not busy, there were a total of 10 patrons present, and they were attended by 3-waitresses, 1-bus, 1-prep, and 1-cook. In other words more than adequate for the load. We ate at the counter as tables are few in number, and the counter is typically faster. We planned to see a movie after dinner. Our meals were prepared quickly, looked great, and immediately went under a heat lamp on the counter. Then, they sat there, and sat there, and sat there for 12 minutes under the heat lamp--our waitress was nowhere to be seen. I asked a waitress standing 2 feet in front of us, sacking bread to give to patrons, if she would "please be so kind as to hand us our meals," which we're sitting 4 feet behind her. She looked at me like I'd asked her to loan me money and walked away without answering. Another waitress walked by, and I asked the same thing--by now,  our meals were being pushed down the line under the heat lamp as other meals took priority position. We are now at 15 minutes under the heat lamp. The second waitress said, "just a minute, your waitress will be here shortly." Damn it, I don't want to wait 15 minutes for my meal, when it's been ready all this time, and has been warming for a quarter of an hour. How hard is it to ask a coworker to help you and your customer out by handing them their meals while you do whatever you are doing? Not hard at all. What the heck? Are we invisible? FINALLY, at 16 minutes our waitress reappears, and begins slowly placing her apron, talking to people and colleagues-put now I am pissed, so I begin waving my arms and pointing to our now lukewarm fish and chips sitting under the heat lamp. Noticeably irritated, she walked up and announced, "I'm sorry you had to wait, but I had to use the toilet." You know, I don't care where you were, especially if you were at the toilet, but I do care about my $19.95 fish and chips dinner that is now at best, warm. With disgust she delivers the meals and then makes it a point not to attend to us for the rest of the meal. I did not eat my meal--it was only warm, and fish and chips is supposed to be served piping hot, not heat lamp warm, plus, I hate arrogant, ignorant wait staff. We will never go back, and, we will make sure all our friends know that the service here is really bad, and if you dare to question how you are treated, you won't be treated at all. Resturants come and go in this town, and wait staff and food quality are the primary reasons for failures. I cannot recommend this resturant to anyone given our experience. A total downer, ruined our evening, wasted $40 in food, plus cost of a beer and a glass of wine. It isn't hard to do it right-it really isn't, but when you employ people who could care less about customer service-this is what you get.
Food was fantastic.  my husband had oysters and gumbo and he loved it. The New England clam chowder was great. The service was exceptional  we can't wait until we go back again

Honestly only come here for the food the staff isn't the best. It takes a while to get a seat when there is clearly seats at the bar. It really bugs me when they just keep pass you by and not say a thing. If anyone has a better version of the oyster bar please let me know I am tired of coming here just for mac & cheese with lobster. I am just disappointed at the staff not the cooks!

Moscow Mule was delicious! Shrimp gumbo was soooooo flavorful and tasty. Service was a little bit slow but wasn't too bad. I love that I hardly ever catch a line when I come here. Check this place out for sure.

This location rivals the original at Palace Station.  I got the kitchen sink pot and my wife got the combo pot.  Spiced perfectly, also 6 each of Fanny Bays, and Stellar Bay oysters all very fresh and tasty.  Excellent service from Emily topped off a very enjoyable dinner.

This is my favorite place to eat in Las Vegas. The wait staff is really nice and the service is always excellent. 
Great food.

So far, my wife and I have been waiting in line for at least 40 minutes. She really wants to try this place. I think it is absolutely ridiculous to have such a small establishment and know that you will have plenty of people lined up to eat seafood but you don't have enough seats to go around. As of this moment, I am giving this place a 2 star rating until I sit and taste the food.

So, I guess an update is in order.

We FINALLY got seated and we ordered our meals. I had the fish and chips and the missus had the house gumbo. She really enjoyed it and I thought it was pretty good. My meal was good: fish was flaky and very well battered. Chips were decent as well.

Overall, I give this joint 4 stars. I'm adding 2 to the 2 already given. But take my advice: expand the seating when you expand the kitchen. 

UPDATE: Wife and I went again this past Friday (5/27/16) and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. We had the Fish N' Chips and the Lump Crab Ceasar Salad. Best meal we've had outside of our own cooking. The service was 5 Star (Thank You to Alam and Emily). We'll be visiting the Oyster Bar at least once a month.

My first experience with pan roast was at the original Oyster Bar at Palace Station. It was truly a once-in-a-while treat until (so I've heard) some of the original people there branched off and opened up some spots in SoCal: Ritter's and Kettlebar. Now, I didn't get to review any of those places as I'll kinda tell you that... well, they all kinda taste the same to me.

But maybe it's because they're all from the same school of pan roast. In any case, this newly opened branch of the Station Casinos' Oyster Bar chain is on par with its pan roast peers.

It did stand out in that it made for a memorable experience for myself and my family. They were one or two people down and it was pretty obvious cause they were juggling serving people and finished tables were waiting to be cleaned. But through smiles and solid customer service, the staff as a whole were able to make it work til close. And even the line banded together to help assist the server in working out where each party would sit.

Highlights were, of course, the combo pan roast. It's a savory dish that's meant to be shared, lest you want to drive home with food coma. (No one wants that.) Honestly, my fams and I got that. My fiancée and I got the level 6 spice for ours but it wasn't that spicy. Step it up if you want that kick. My dad found the clam chowder to one of the best he's ever had, and he's pretty hard to please. Trust. 

On seating... there's way more than the one at Palace Station. But there's still not a ton. In any case, it may seem like that line ain't movin... but trust, you'll get there. You'll get your pan roast.

My boyfriend and I go to this place regularly and it never disappoints! The food is great!! Not sure what people are complaining about. Their oysters are to die for! My personal favorites are the crab cocktail and the fish and chips, and of course, you can't go wrong with a seafood jackpot :)

Its a horrible setup. 4 regular tables and cramped bar area. Seating can take a long time. Waited at least 30 to 45 minutes for a seat (preferably @ the bar since I was just a party of 1). I gave up out of hunger and took a table when it was offered
The clam chowder was disappointing. It tasted like it was out of a can.
I also had the seafood mac n cheese. It was actually a little disappointing especially after seeing all the food being served while on line. 
Service is really rushed and they try to get you to leave your table as soon as possible. Not coming back any time soon.
The service is very slow.. We ordered our main course with our appetizers (2 dozen). The appetizers took 45 minutes and the main course (Gumbo)took 1:30 minutes to get to our table.

This little spot was delicious!! I've heard that usually the wait for this spot is a long time but luckily we only waited about 10min. We sat at the bar where you can see all the magic happen lol our server was Tammy (btw hi Tammy I told you I would give a shout out to you on yelp lol) who was extremely welcoming and super nice. Everyone was really nice and even the room chef stopped to ask how the food tasted. I ordered 1/2 dozen of Fanny Bay oysters which where tasty and pan roast I had them give me a side of pasta instead of the rice. My husband had the shrimp linguine with white sauce I had a bite of it and it was really good. I would definitely come back to this place real soon.

Came on a Friday night with no wait & was seated right away at the bar. It is really hit or miss since the Oyster Bar is not very big.. luckily, we had no issue. The service was excellent and was truly impressed with their "Combo Pan Roast" (shrimp,lobster & crab) its the only thing that will be bringing me back. Was not a very big fan of the complimentary bread they provided.

Noooooo!! The buttery garlic bread is no longer!!! Love the pan roast here and the lines aren't as long here compared to the one at Palace Station. I was so sad when down plopped a stale looking bowl of sourdough bread instead of my beloved warm, toasty, buttery garlic bread. The server said they stopped serving it a while back. So sad! That's why I'm only giving 4 stars. Please, bring back the garlic bread.

Oyster are delicious. Sampled the Stellar Bay and Fanny Bay oysters. The Stellers are nice size and tasty. While the Fanny Bay's are good, they are rather small. 

Had a nice crab cocktail, followed by a dozen Gold Band Oysters. This year the Gulf Coast oysters have been outstanding. 

Will certainly return.

I would like to give you an update from my last review. We came back today upon Alan the food and beverage manager request to make it right. I must say our waitress Emily and Su Chef who prepared our dinner was all on point! Thank you for making it right. Santa Fe Oyster Bar Big thumbs up to you all.

So finally this place open we are regulars at the oyster bar at Palace Station we decided we needed to try this place because it's much closer to home and we were tired of the three-hour wait for Palace Station which is by the way very well worth it so we came to the oyster bar at Santa Fe Station we were seated and greeted by the manager I believe his name is John super cool dude love him he was awesome if it wasn't for him we would have left the restaurant we are seated at the bar it took about maybe 25 minutes before the server Corey who had horrible customer service to come and greet us. 2 people were seated next to us and their server gave them water gave them bread took their order before our server even came to ask us if we wanted anything to drink.We had to end up calling over John to find out what's going on with the server she was walking back and forth in front of us several times before she even took our orders or even made eye contact.We ordered the kitchen pan roast I believe with Lobster it was good the food was great awesome it's up there with the original Palace Station oyster bar but the customer service from Corey made my experience horrible. We had to ask Kory to refill our drinks and it took us like 3 or 4 times to get her attention she would not paying any attention we had to like kind of like I had her down to actually get her to see it and we're sitting at the bar to get her to fill our drinks when we got ready to go we needed to go bags she says oh I have other orders in front of you so just wait a minute when she bagged up our food she threw our bread away which is really good she threw the bread away I didn't have any bread to eat when I brought my food home. That's pretty much it luckily I love food so the experience was horrible but you know I'll give it another try because I do love the food there but Corey I hope you read this and really take note on your attitude

I have been going to this oyster bar since it opened. Each time my food was prepared by chef JJ and it was excellent . Tonight chef Robert prepared my Alaskan clam chowder. It was lukewarm, extremely watery and the clams served with it were not fully open. I also noticed that there was less shrimp,crab and lobster added in. I think this may be a part of the restaurants cutbacks and not the chefs fault.I sent it back and it came back hot but it was still watered down. My husband also felt his pan roast was not as tasty as it usually is.  I have always ordered this same meal and never had problems in the past. If you go just make sure you ask for chef JJ to prepare your meal that way you can have a 5 star experience.

My Wife and I have been to this place 3 weeks in a row and that says a lot since my wife usually can only that a place once and she is over it. She actully craves this place and I have to say it is on par with the palace station oyster bar. We always get a lobster pan roast along with a ceaser salad to share. With that I usually will order something new to try i.e. the lobster roll which had huge chunks of lobster and awesome seasoned fries and  the fish and chips have a good flavor and texture. They also have a very good beer/drink selection. We are coming back for the 4th week bring her mom. The only real issue is the service, it can be slow but I know its bound to get better.

Amazing service! This place I would give 10 stars if I could for the amazing swift service and the food! I had the combo pan roast. Shrimp, lobster, and crab.. it's an amazing mix! There was a plethora of all this seafood! It was amazing! Definitely got our moneys worth. Be sure to get the pacific oysters, they were super sweet and didn't have a fishy taste. JJ behind the counter cooking was awesome he sucked our oysters. Came out presentable and appealing. Thank you to the crew for the great service and Daniel for taking care of us for my man's bday! We will def be back.
Only got a 1 star because staff was nice, food was cooked properly but bland sub par and overpriced. The whole Cason including this restaurant could use a face lift on the bar options.

Went here after the movies and we got the combo pan roast and jambalaya. Let me tell you...these are HUGE portions. Definitely share. You get to choose your spice level from 1-10. I went for a 4 and I can say I could go a bit higher next time I'm there. While the jambalaya was good, I thought the pan roast was better. Next time I'm at an Oyster Bar, I'll definitely get the pan roast! 

The restaurant is on the small side. However they have plenty of TVs in there which was perfect for watching the Golden Knights game. 

The server we had was great! She was attentive and made sure our drinks were always filled. She did a great job of explaining the menu too. I wish I had gotten her name! 

Will definitely be back to Oyster Bar!

Well it was great ... at first.  I think 13 bucks for 4 shrimp isn't really a cocktail.  But it is vegas. We got the 1/2 dozen speciality oysters.  They were very good. The last one was a little earthy.  I got home and then was sick violently from both ends.  I really enjoyed the overpriced poison mostly.

60 bucks for 4 shrimp, 6 oysters and two drinks.  Oh and they tried to change me for a split instead of the glass of brut I ordered.  I feel like they stole from me

I've been going to the oyster bar for over 4 years . We enjoy seeing are usual server Ana . She has a great personality and remembers us every time we visit ! 
Me and my husband enjoy the shrimp pot roast , lobster roast , shrimp po boy grilled and fried and the fish and chips. Everything is fresh and made to order which is nice . 

Everything is cooked right in front of you if your sitting at the main bar . There is also additional seating and tables if you choose not to sit at the bar or have a larger group . Over the years there has been various changes in the chefs but for the most part the food has remained the same . I would say in the past I would've given it 5 stars because the old chef used to interact with the guest and over the last 3 years and us busting the chefs aren't personable . 

To get the five stars I would say it would be nice to have more interactive servers and chefs . Lastly , work on making the desserts better and add back the customer service portion of your receipts ! You can't be a great if you don't listen to what you need to do to improve or highlight what's great .

Combo pan roast is my favorite as it is extremely delicious. I've been here three times to get the same dish and each time was phenomenal- second visit's dish did have a bit more shell pieces but not many. Sometimes the wait time for service is a bit slow even when there isn't many patrons. And I'm not talking about food service but rather when the waitress finally noticed us to take our order and serve our drinks.

Just finished eating at the oyster bar inside the Santa Fe casino, we ordered the lobster roll & fries and the combo pan roast and this food was absolutely amazing (plus a clam chowder appetizer) I couldn't find anything wrong w/our meal if I tried,this was by far one of the best oyster bars we've eaten at that was just the food,the service was as good as the food,talk about courteous & friendly (shout out to "the man" chef Travis and our very nice waitress Emily) there is absolutely no doubt we'll be "regulars" here as long as Travis & Emily are here as well

The Oyster bar is a staple restaurant in the "Station" line of casinos, Santa Fe Station, Sunset Station, Texas Station and Palace Station.  The reason i came to this location was because there was a line that was about 15 people long at Palace station which could take up to 2 hours, trust me i've waited before.  So i figure I'd drive for about 20 minutes and save myself some time, so glad i did.

When i got there noticed that they are not open 24/7 like at Palace Station, they open for dinner at 5.  When i got there there was no line, there were open seats at the counter and better still there were tables, not just the counter like at Palace Station.  Also because its not in the middle of the casino, but its own separate restaurant, kids or people under the age of 21 can eat here!  Just some of the reasons is better than Palace Station which is infamous for their long wait times.  Its also very modern design to it.

Service was very friendly and cheery, i got the combination gumbo with crab and shrimp only (omitted the lobster, its only small bits and pieces rolled out of the legs), spice level 4 was perfect, had a good amount of heat but still able to taste the flavor of the gumbo.  It was not as good as i remember at Palace Station, but then again i omitted stuff and the other time was my first time, but still Very VERY good.  It came with a nice slice of toasted buttery bread and a scoop of rice.  So good but I must be getting older because i couldn't finish the whole thing.  So I had a wonderful breakfast the next morning!

Oyster bar, Santa Fe Station Vs. Palace Station

Santa Fe Station
Pros
- No (or shorter) lines during heavy hours
- More seats including tables
- More modern
- Not in the middle of the casino (under 21 can eat here)

Cons
- Further from the strip
- Not open 24/7
- Don't have the Étouffée that the other Oyster Bars offer
- There is not an individual steam pot in front of each seat, (for show) but its still made individually in its own pot in the cooks work station, its just more efficient for the guy to make them all in one place than to move from station to station. (so its a pro for efficiency and a con for showmanship)

Despite not having the Étouffée, I'll be coming here from now on rather than Palace Station.  Or maybe i'll try Texas Station which is a few $ cheaper, but i really like this casino and the modern feel of this Oyster bar.
Oh my god..Im going to die...I am so stuffed and my mouth is on fire... and we got the combo pan roast 1-3 amateur level on the heat scale....I am a wuss! House oysters were great!

Very excited to have a good oyster bar on this side of town. Checked it out for Valentine's Day. Emily - our server was very nice and helpful. My husband did a dozen oysters and loved them. They give you lots of sauces to jazz them up too if you like. They are shucked right in front of you if you sit at the bar. I had the clam chowder and it was delicious. The only reason they lost a star was for seating. There are only three tables and the rest is at the bar. I know it's an oyster bar so that's kind of the idea, but you wait in this weird queue rather than putting your name in. You have no access to drinks from this establishment while waiting, so if there is a line and you want a beverage hit up a casino bar on your way. Plus once we were seated I felt kind of guilty hanging out while I could clearly see all the people waiting empty handed probably willing me to stop talking and finish my wine. They should have a waitress offer drinks to the guests in line. The tequila oyster shooter was also a favorite for my hubs :)

Good food but very slow service and very strange presentation of food. You would think a place that specializes in seafood would understand that when a customer orders an entree of Alaskan Crab Legs for $51.99 that the butter would be served melted and hot or on a candle burner. Nope here they plop the bowl of butter in the middle of the ice plate housing the crab legs. Guess what? Coagulated butter unusable for dipping within a few minutes. Wow. Of course it took us several more minutes to get our waitresses attention to bring melted butter separately. Very slow service all around. We sat for a good 20 minutes after ordering without anyone checking on us. I ordered the Ceasar Salad to share at the table thinking it would be nice before the food but nope, it arrived with everything else about 25 minutes after ordering.

My fiancé and I tried this place on Thursday night. What an absolutely pleasant surprise. It's small and casual. We ordered the seafood jambalaya and lobster, shrimp, crab pan roast. Holy cow was it delicious. The food was obviously prepared with top notch ingredients. Did I mention it was delicious?? The portions are huge. The monkey bread we had for dessert was simply Devine. It's so awesome to have a great restaurant alternative in the NW valley. Yum!!

Was so excited this place finally opened at this casino and so, we gave it a try.

Having tried steam kettle cooked restaurants around southern california, we were excited and curious how it would be.

We were somewhat pleased. Our server gal was great. Executive chef even came out to our table at some point to ask how everything was. 

We ordered half dozen special oysters, shrimp pan roast level 7 and kitchen sink pan roast level 3. Bread that comes out was tasty with hints of garlic butter. The oysters were fresh shucked and DELICIOUS!!!! We regretted ordering more but as soon as our food came out...all regret was gone. The bowls were enormous! They were tasty and full of meat and seafood. Having tried other similar places, we were just as pleased however, veggies (or the trinity) could be diced a bit smaller. 

Weird thing that happened though. At one point throughout our meal, my man and I were using our condiment caddy throughout our dining and some blonde server all of a sudden just took it away and gave it to someone at the counter. Not a word she just took it!!! I mean...wtf?! We don't like to cause confrontation or gripe so we just let it go but seriously...wtf?! Luckily sous chef was walking around and we asked him for another. 

Overall, we were pleased (minus klepto blonde server). Just wish hours were like palace station heehee but we understand.

UPDATE:  Alam Leyva, Director of Food & Beverage contacted me regarding my previous post and genuinely expressed his concern with our displeasure.  He invited us to return and when we arrived on Friday, March 18th we were treated like royalty.  That horrible hostess was not there and the customer service was AWESOME.  Corina was our waitress and she was GREAT.  She was pleasant and very attentive.  Chef Travis Beavers was Great also.  He mingled with the patrons and made it a pleasant visit.  Alam seemed to truly care that we were satisfied.  The entire experience left us feeling great.  This time we ordered the House Gumbo and it was AWESOME.  I believe everyone should be treated like this on every visit.  People are coming to your establishment and spending their hard earned money.  A little quality customer service goes a long way.  My husband and I will visit the Oyster Bar in the Santa Fe again to see if the customer service continues.  Thank you Alam, Corina and Chef Travis.  You provided us with a memorable experience.  Because you are the first line of contact with the patrons and did such a wonderful job, you deserve a 5 STAR RATING!  

My husband and I went to the Oyster Bar in Santa Fe Station on March 11, 2016.  We arrived around 4:30 pm and there was already a long line.  Me and another lady went to speak to the hostess and asked why there was only a few people sitting in there eating.  The hostess stated that 8 Chairman cardholders are allowed to enter at 4:30 pm and 8 more Chairman cardholders at 4:45 pm.  This place only holds around 20 people (4 tables that can seat 2 and the remaining at the bar).  I asked why limited seating.  Hostess stated that it's an Oyster Bar!  REALLY!  The Orleans and Texas Station both have Oyster Bars and with plenty of room to seat many patrons.  Ordered the Fish & Chips for  $19.99.  We got 2 pieces of fish with fries.  The lady next to us received 3 pieces of fish.  Where's the consistency!!!  The fish was bland and the fries were the best part of the meal.  I've had better fish elsewhere.  For the cost of this stuff, it was NOT worth it!   We will not be returning to this Oyster Bar!!!!!

Palace Station is a 10. Santa Fe is a 4. Tried my Palace favorites, combo pan roast and Alaskan New England clam chowder. Pan roast was more vegetable than seafood flavor here and salty. The clam chowder was watery and had lobster in it that smelled like it turned a day ago. It has more seating, but the wait was still 1 hour. They lack that Palace station New York hustle.  Our server was having a bad day maybe cause it showed. But, the chefs were really nice. Also we ordered a half dozen of the house oysters that were actually better than the ones I've tried at Palace station.

First time at this oyster bar. I honestly didn't know this place was here until my friend mentioned. You have to wait to be seated. It's not as big as the one at the Texas. Also not a lot of table seating either. While waiting for the food you get 3 slices of bread, unlike at the Texas you have a variety of beads.   I had the kitchen pan fried with shrimp,  sausage, chicken,  and lobster. It was served in a big bowl with a cup of rice. It was so big I had to take home the rest. My friend likes the kitchen pan combo here than at the Texas. I ordered a 5 on the spice level,  which wasn't spicy at all.  The meal was delicious! We had a great server, who was patient,  friendly,  and professional.

Had a great time. I had the 'kitchen sink'. I order spice level 5. It was perfect.   Yummy. 

I'll definitely be back!

I have to admit, this looks like a really great opportunity when we got in line to have a table. But despite the view, everything else went downhill. The oysters that we had were terribly gritty from being shucked poorly. The link weenie with clam sauce, on the first try was extremely watery. We ask that they send it back and reduce the sauce to make it a bit more creamy. Unfortunately, when you came back it was more watery have been the last time, and it took about a pound of Parmesan cheese and a cup of salt to correct the issue. On a positive note, the Alaskan clam chowder was excellent. Unfortunately, the time that it took to get us our food, we could have driven to Alaska. Two stars solid. No more no less. First and last time.

We live close by and have eaten here quite a few times and never disappointed. It had been over two months since we last ate here and to our surprise they changed their bread! No more garlic toasted bread. That was a bit disappointing. Secondly I order a crab cocktail, not at all what I thought I was ordering. Crab over a few pieces of salad? Wow that was surprising because it did not mention in the menu what to expect. Please bring back the garlic bread and make an adjustment to the menu.

We live very close to the Sante Fe Casino and visit the Oyster Bar often.  The food is always good however the service is intermittent.  We usually start with a dozen oysters which my husband and I share (I really wish they served clams on the half shell).  Then we share another dish from the menu.  This time we tried the Seafood Jambalaya and it was not one of their better dishes.  We found it to be too dry however the waitress asked the chef to make some sauce which we added table side.  It was better but not something we would order again.  Most of the time we have their gumbo dishes and they are always delicious.  We usually pay with points we have accumulated from gambling so that makes it even better.  In the month of September they are only charging half points so I am certain we will be back there again soon.

Can't say enough good things about this place! The chefs really make the experience. Al, JJ, and Juan kept us entertained all evening. The food was incredible as always, fresh and expertly prepared. This location absolutely measures up to the OG location at the Palace Station. Little to no wait and fabulous service!
Outstanding!!!! Nothing can compare and Robert os the greatest host ever! I would recommend this seafood place to everyone.

So glad they have delicious pan roast on this side of town! The pan roast tastes exactly like palace stations minus the 3 hour wait!

The menu differs as well, as this location has fish and chips and other menu items.

The oysters were amazing (as always) and the meal portions are huge!

My husband and I love this place!  The staff is friendly and the food is delicious.  I usually get the combo pan roast--level 3 for spiciness and he gets the gumbo.  The portions are big so be ready to take some home.

I want to rate this place higher because the food is excellent, but I'm not going to because of the service we received twice. I just want to say, someone in a wheelchair should not have to wait 1 hour for a table because they only have 4 tables and over 20 seats at the bar. I get we make the decision to eat here but why can't you accommodate those who only have one choice of a place to sit? And for the same waitress to continue to overlook you while you stand/sit there? For those prices I expect way better service. That's why I personally will not be going back.

I don't know who designed this place but they only have 4 tables and the rest is bar seating. They do not take reservations either. We had five people in our party and they said it would take 15 minutes. We waited and waited off to the side and they kept seating smaller parties at the only tables. We ended up saying screw it and left. We went to the Mexican restaurant afterwards and the people ahead of us had the same exact issue right before us.They have more than enough room to add more tables, i'm not sure why they don't. The person who arranged the seating should be fired for the amount of business they have lost/are losing.

The first time i went, the Shrimp Scampi was good (that's why i'm giving them 2 stars). If you have a party of 2+ people, find another place to eat.

The fish and chips are amazing!!! Small wait in line but so worth it. The pan roast is good too but doesn't beat the fish and chip. The fries are seasoned with a salt and vinegar amazing! You have to try it.

We have been waiting for the "Oyster Bar" to open and man was it worth the wait.
Had some oysters, steamers and split two main courses   . The staff delivered on all!!!!!
We will be back soon!

They literally drive to the Pacific Ocean and fish for your food right after you order. Be prepared to sit for over an hour even when they aren't busy to get your food. Oh and a refill of water, hope it rains in Vegas or else you may die of thirst.

1 hour and they brought 1 of the 4 dishes we ordered. Paid for what was served and left. They have the nerve to tell my children, "hope you had a good night."  Ah no I don't think they did, they are hungry!

Would love to give this place 0 stars if I could!

Usually go to the Original Oyster Bar at Palace Station Which I absolutely love. It was 10 til 5 pm and I walked in over to the bar where as I might add people were already sitting inside, to look at the menu to see if this place was the same as the one at Palace station and the waitress was so rude told me We are not open yet and we have to sit you You don't seat yourself when I was not even looking like I was going to sit down. And honestly she was so close to me I thought she was going to push me out. So I found out my answer This place is nothing like the original Oyster Bar at Palace, The  waitresses at Palace Station are tactful, funny and amazing at their job! I will NEVER come back to THIS place! I give this place 0 in customer service!

i dined there yesterday, I ordered the gumbo. The gumbo was advertised as having shrimp,crab,lobster and sausage . I was fishing through the regular tasting gravy for the lobster and noticed there was none there. I brought it to the attention of the staff, there waitress responded saying she would let the  chef and manager know . However once they were notified , I witnessed a meeting in plain view . It was kind of embarrassing to witness and made me feel like i was a problem . Yes when spending  23.00 for a plate  I expect it to have whats advertised . I am giving this review because the manager never came to see how he could make it better , but found time to communicate with other guest that was spending money just like I was a paying guest as well. I rate this very unprofessional. No customer service was delivered.

This oyster bar is great to dine in for some delicious seafood. The bar dining counter has plenty of seats for multiple guest and the restaurant is filled with large sized tvs throughout. There are also variety of seating arrangements. For those seeking a more intimate dining, there are some niche banquettes that create a little more privacy. The dinner portion are large enough to be shared with someone or not. The pan roasts are top notch rich in flavors. Spice levels vary but a level 5 is just enough to give some nice flavors.

I would not recommend this place. 

Firstly, from the beginning, we waited in line to be seated, and the restaurant was slow for a Friday night. It took them a few minutes to seat us, I noticed that the waitress was busy socializing with her coworker instead of noticing customers waiting in line to be seated with plenty of open tables.

Secondly, after ordering our food, it took them about 45 minutes for it to come out, and once it was done, it wasn't brought right away because the waitress was still socializing with her coworkers as well as the chefs. After she served the food to us, less then one bite into the linguine with clams, it tasted so sour that we couldn't eat it. And instead of the server coming to ask us if everything is okay, she didn't acknowledge that the dish wasn't even touched. Obviously something is wrong when you don't see someone eating their food. We felt that they didn't care or even try to make it right. Again, the food was just awful and so was the service. If there was an option to put no stars I would.

Great service, awesome staff. The girl behind the bar is a G. Runs the whole show. The chef and the gentlemen behind the bar do the same. Work so quickly and everything was so good. Everyone there had a great attitude. So professional and helpful. Oysters were great. Will return soon.

I got in line at the oyster bar 30min prior to it opening at 5pm.  As 5 drew near, I watched with aggravation, 3 parties seated ahead of me because they were "VIP", because these people gamble there A LOT they earned some BS status that allowed them some perks, like jumping the line to eat.  Basically, I felt discriminated against because I'm not a gambler. After speaking with Travis and being told that the "higher ups" granted these perks he couldn't do anything about it. The place is freaking too small to allow these "VIP" access and push everyone else's wait time over an hr. Travis and his staff did their best to pacify my anger but in the end the stupid "higher ups" need to rethink what they are trying to achieve with this location, for me, I felt alienated because I don't sit and donate money to machines regularly like these "VIP". I will be going to the oyster bar at Texas station or wait two hrs at palace station because I'll at least know I earned my seat and everyone else in front of me paid their due by standing in the same lines.  The worst experience I've ever had with any of the oyster bar locations and that includes the 2+ hrs I've waited in line at palace station.

We walked in wanting to share their Fish & Chips and Lobster Roll.

Other reviews and tips state that the garlic bread is gone, pan roast is different,  and overall flavor of things have gone downhill.

Waiting in line,  I see other parties receive the fish and chips and see that it's NO LONGER THE TAIL-ON LOUP DE MER that they used to serve...not good. Probably a cheaper substitute with no tail.

Sitting up at the bar perusing the menu, not only have prices gone up, but the Lobster Roll is no longer on the menu. We flag down a waitress to inquire about the fate of the Lobster Roll and she confirms that it had been removed even though it was a good seller and her personal favorite!? Why??? "CORPORATE" she answered...Figures.

The "higher ups" want to keep costs down and quality up using cheaper ingredients and upping the price in the process. Disappointed that one of the few delicious things on the menu were no more. Staff was apologetic, and we politely left with no intention of coming here again...it is what it is...ALOHA!!!

Shaka Meter: 0

The food is not as good as before, the size of the dishes are much smaller compared with last year ones. I ordered a seafood jambalaya and it was bad. The rice is too dry without any sauce. The shrimps are small and only has one small piece of lobster in it. I was so disappointed.
I've been here several times and absolutely love the pan roast! I pretty much just get that every time now.  The servers are great.  The food is great.  Can't recommend it enough!

Me and my friend meet up here for some combo roast pan. The combo roast pan was ok. I like the one at the palace station better. More lobster and shrimp. The flavors was a lil off. The reason why I have them 3 stars is because when me and my friend ordered our pan roast..... they asked us how hot do we want it from 1-10. I said 5 and my friend said 2. When the bowls came out to us ..... I think they have my bowl to my friend and I had her bowl so... they messed up our bowls plus I was halfway done with my bowl and my friend had to re order her bowl because it was too spicy. So it wasn't edible for us because it was too spicy.
Best oyster bar ever!  Super fresh, chilled goodness.  Kusshi and Kumamotos are my favorites.  Contemporary ambience, great customer service.  Highly recommend and I will be coming back soon.

Got lucky I thought wait was standard. Placed my order then the wait went on....I watched plates go up, watched for minutes and more minutes as two servers scattered clueless on what's next on their to do list. Effortless to serve customers their fresh cooked hot meal. They took their time. Then as I waited 45 minutes after I ordered, the chef seemed to disappear. And my wait continued! Terrible.... would have rather waited in the Palace Station line. The one star was just because I had to put one. The overall rating was negative 3!

Was really looking forward to some crab and gumbo but after waiting 41 mins I didn't get any. It was a slow night as all seats weren't filled and the staff was slow as well. One table's food sat under the heat lamps for 20 mins! I prayed it wasn't my gumbo. Only one table was eating so we couldn't understand what the hold up was. We politely paid for our drinks and left. I'll stick with the Texas location.

This was the second oyster bar that I've been to and I was quite impressed with the food, the service, and the surroundings.

I had studied the menu before going and knew that I wanted to get the combo pan roast--a combination of shrimp, lobster, and crab in a tomato based stock.  This was the first time I was ever asked how spicy I wanted my food on a scale of 1 to 10.  I went with 8 but I'll go higher next time although 8 is good spice.  There were a few beads of perspiration on my forehead as I finished but I'm sure it was because I was dressed warmly.  

While I waited for the roast, the server brought me iced tea and some bread to munch on.  The iced tea was refilled several times and she brought a glass of ice so I could replenish what melted.

There was a good amount of lobster and shrimp.  The crab is more in shreds than pieces.  The flavor of the broth was excellent and I really liked choosing a spice level.  The portion size is very large!  You need no more than one scoop of rice in the roast to make the dish completely filling.  I didn't eat all the bread and I'm glad I didn't.  I was full when I finished the pan roast.  I think I'll see if I can get a 1/2 portion when I visit again.  

I'd recommend you sit at the bar facing the cooking.  It's fun watching cooks at work.

Really enjoyed this place! Service was wonderful (Corey was our amazing waitress/bartender) and there was no wait time. We enjoyed the lump crab cocktail and hubby sampled some oysters which he really enjoyed. I fell in love with the combo pan roast and hubby raved about the Alaskan clam chowder. The cocktails were great too...try the Pimms no. 1 cup! We will be back soon!

I have really enjoyed this place.  Great people serving and cooking, and amazing food.  Tonight's disappointing experience is because someone has decided to lower the quality of the food.  Fish and chips that used to feature large skin-on fillets full of flavor and Crispness replaced with shriveled haddock fish product things.  Just so sad to see the oyster bar throw in the towel on quality food.

It's about that time for another rhyme,
I came here for dinner with my partner in dine.

They're in Santa Fe Station, up around the Northwest,
We dined here for dinner for our Pan Roast taste test. 

Let's start with the service, specifically the wait,
40 minutes, not bad. Not gonna hate.

I was a little annoyed since tables needed bussing,
The food was fabulous. So, I ain't fussing.

I had the oysters and we shared the rest,
When it comes to Pan Roast, OB's the best.

The chowder was thick, tasty, and hearty,
The oysters were huge and can feed a party.

Back to the highlight and I'll keep it real,
At $22.99, the Pan Roast's a steal. 

Tons of bisque, lobster, crab, and shrimp,
Just like Palace Station, this one doesn't skimp. 

Our cook remembered us and his name is Al,
He asked our opinion. My response was WOW!

I told him that their Pan Roast was awesome and the rest was good,
What's even better? You're in my hood. 

Peace!!!


TIP #1:  Get extra rice if you want your Pan Roast thicker.

TIP #2:  They don't charge extra for sharing.

TIP #3:  Come hungry. 

NOTES:
-40 minute wait on a Friday night.
-Opens at 5:00 PM


2016 Yelp Review #29

Like the other reviews say, this place is super small. We went after the dinner rush so only waited about five minutes to be seated. The waitress (wearing too tight pants that allowed her stomach roll to hang out under her too short shirt-not appealing in a restaurant) greeted us right away and took our drink order, an iced tea and a water. The bf ordered jambalaya and I, the clam chowder bread bowl. Maybe 15 minutes later the jambalaya came. I ate some of the bf's food while waiting for my chowder. It was good (not great-not enough seafood and too many green things (celery?) in it) but the bowl was plenty huge for two people to share. The waitress came and refilled my bf's iced tea but ignored my empty water glass until he asked her to refill it. She never mentioned what the holdup on my clam chowder was. Ten minutes after that she brought us the bill and charged us for the clam chowder EVEN THOUGH SHE NEVER BROUGHT IT! I'd, maybe, understand if we were a larger party and ordered a lot of food, but there were only two of us and we only ordered two things! How could she not notice there was no food sitting in front of me the entire time? I handed her back the bill and told her her mistake and she gave a short apology but never offered to bring the chowder, or any other sort of amends. We were really looking forward to going here when the signs first appeared on the Santa Fe of its arrival, however, we won't be returning.

OB was out of the good oysters, the service was terrible, and the linguini with white white clam sauce lacked garlic. Buy a can of Progresso, cook the linguini yourself and you will be better off.

The chefs are interested and aggressive. The manager is nice. I may try this again.

Service was great.  Food was great.  I don't understand the lack of tables as there was plenty of un-used space.  There is always a line so I didn't understand why there isn't more tables.  Food and service is worth waiting for.  Nothing special for birthdays which needs to improve.

Well, I wanted to eat here but, no one would acknowledge us while we were waiting in line, even though there were two open tables and no one else in line but us! I would have continued to wait if anyone could have at least said we will be with you in a minute or thanks for waiting.. anything really!
After waiting quite some time one of the customers walked out shaking his head and said service is really slow...
It's sad because we have been wanting to eat here for a quite some time. Even though a lot of the reviews are negative we wanted to give it a try... 
I guess we can try one of the other locations... :-(

Something's gone horribly wrong. This used to be a fun, tasty place to eat. Now, no more lobster roll. Food takes for ever. No one working here has a smile, and the food quality has dropped. Heading to a Cousins good truck next time I  want lobster. SO DISAPPOINTED.

MMMMM Oyster Bar..... I am really glad a location opened that is close to my house and doesn't have a two hour wait. May be I shouldn't write this review... I would hate for this place to get insanely busy and prevent me from getting my Pan Roast! BACK UP!!!!
Oyster bar in all honestly is delicious, I couldn't deny it even if I tried. The flavor and quality matches the one in Palace Station. I love the creamy tomatoey broth packed with seafood. Oh, if you've never had a pan roast, you need to put your shoes on RIGHT NOW!
This location has a few more seating options, they have a few tables you can pick from if you're opting out of sitting at the bar. What I also appreciate here is that they serve cocktails. The lovely server/bartender helped me pick my drink. Delicious! I know it had rum, that is all. 
I brought half of my plate home and enjoyed it for two more meals, soo much food for such a decent price considering it's seafood.

Went there with my wife for dinner after the movies.  They should open before 5pm to start.  We were seated and then they brought us bread but server said they were out of butter.  I ordered Oysters on the 1/2 dozen specialty ones for $14.99.  They didn't bring them to me until our main courses came.  Very disappointed with the size of the oysters and the service was less than acceptable. We will not be returning the this place.

Definitely on my top 5 places to eat in Vegas. Whether you go to this one or the OG spot at palace station.. expect a wait. I've waited up to 3 hours (well worth it). Even though a wait is always expected, the service is rapid fire once you're seated. I'm not sure if it was just low staffing during Father's Day, but I was disappointed when it took 15min+ to even get a water and menu.
After we received our drinks and put in our order, every thing was great. Our server was super friendly and attentive. We got oyster shooters to start out with which are so savory they could be a meal in itself. The shooters were followed by gold band oysters, straight from Louisiana. These oysters are so big and juicy, even a dozen looks intimidating. We got shrimp cocktail and lump crab cocktail which are the perfect appetizers. We accompanied it with the Father's Day special crab boil which came with the BEST andouille sausage. For the piece de resistance.. we got my favorite thing on the planet...  combo PAN ROAST. It is a rich, creamy, tomato-y base with rice and creole spices with giant chunks of crab, lobster, and shrimp. I didn't get a picture because it is too good to wait! Another favorite of mine is their New England clam chowder. I dream about both regularly.

A one hour line/wait to be seated, but at least the folks in the line were fun and cash and carry drinks are nearby. The service is out of sync. The waitstaff kept bringing the wrong order. Our waitress was also doubling as a line "schmoozer" an not keeping up. The clam chowder had had unincorporated chunks of dry flour. Our first bill belonged to another table, our second bill had extra charges for items not ordered... third time was a charm. Love the convenient location. I hope they regroup and get it together.

This location of the Oyster Bar at the Santa Fe is convenient, but it is absolutely not at the same level of quality of Pan Roast that is being served at the Palace Station location. It might be the same recipe..... but it is not the same quality. Don't get me wrong, it is good..... just not great! I have been here twice, and will definitely come back on those days when I am wanting that warm, rich and creamy Combination Pan Roast and not wanting to wait in line for two hours. 
I am giving the food 3.5 stars, but the service is great so I boosted it up to four stars.  Both times we have had Brittany as our server, and she was very helpful, friendly and attentive.
It seemed to me, that a number of customers at this location are cranky and impatient. The place had just opened at 5:00 PM, (I didn't realize until this last visit that the hours are only for dinner here, unlike the 24 hours at Palace Station) and the line wasn't bad at all just a handful of customers but people were complaining.
The pan roast is made to order so it takes a minute to make, or at least to make it well. 
I feel like this location actually rushes the process to appease the clientele and in doing so lowers the quality of the food. If you aren't willing to wait it out you should go next door to the buffet.
What a phenomenal meal! This chef was here but left for a while... thank God he's back!! Absolutely delicious!
Had the pleasure of eating dinner here and it was great! Very fresh and delicious. Everyone was friendly and accommodating.

Chef Travis was absolutely phenomenal! Communicating and owning it in the visible kitchen across from the bar. (family of 12 took up the entire bar top) The staff was most excellent with their on time serving and smiles added to the customer service. If you like live music consider this a GO-TO. Guitar and surprisingly good vocals to some Pearl Jam. Come in for the food leave full with a smile.

So basically we've been sitting here for the last 30 minutes not once have we gotten a refill for our drinks. So the server went to the table like a few steps away from us refilling drinks and I tried getting her attention and she literally ignored me. Next, another server came again and I literally waved my hand at least 5 ft away and literally ignored me. It's one thing to purposely ignore your customers and another thing if you hate working here! What bad service tonight! I can't say the same when I came here last time.

I have to say i'm a big fan of the oyster bar. The freshness of their oysters, their crab and the pan roast combo make this restaurant one of my favorite spots. I have to admit that although their original location at the palace station has a little better taste, this location is still pretty good minus the hour wait to get a table. The atmosphere and decore is pretty modern and pleasant. We had the opportunity to try different dishes at this restaurant and my ultimate favorite is the pan roast combo. If you have never been there, you must try this dish. This plate is great for sharing unless you wanna have all the deliciousness just for yourself!!

Been here a few times now and each visit has been pretty consistent so I feel like I know what I'm getting when I come here. Haven't experienced a long line, but I've also planned around the peak dinner hours.

My go to is the pan roast. Honestly I don't care about any other dish here. When ordering you have the choice of rice or pasta. For this particular kind of dish, my preference is rice, though the rice has been slightly undercooked on each visit. My friend changed it up on this last visit and got the jambalaya and a variety of oysters which were all tasty but I'm sticking with my pan roast! :) The servings are for sharing, but if you decide not to and can't finish it, it still tastes yummy the next day.

Once you order the wait for the food can take a while so I wouldn't recommend visiting when you're borderline hangry.

Kitchen Sink Pan Roast ($21.99): Shrimp, crab, chicken, and Andouille sausage. The same combination as the Palace Pan Roast at Palace Station. I prefer the pan roast at Palace Station to this one, but it's still very tasty.

Chicken Gumbo ($16.99): Creole stew with Andouille sausage, okra, and chicken. A thick, rich stew served similarly to the pan roasts. It's a decent dish, but not nearly as good as the pan roasts! However, it is a good non-seafood option.

Fish and Chips ($19.99): Tail-on Loup De Mer (Mediterranean Seabass), salt and vinegar chips, lemon dill tartar, and creole remoulade. One of my favorite fish with a fantastic crispy breading. The whole fish is split in half and easy to eat. Delicious chips (fries) as well.

New England Lobster Roll ($19.99): Lobster salad in New England-style bun; served with fries. The lobster salad is delicious and packed with lobster meat. Again, really great fries. These are different than the ones served with the 'Fish and Chips' as these fries have Cajun seasoning.

Alaskan Clam Chowder ($24.99): New England-style with shrimp, crab, and lobster. Amazing chowder! This one is loaded with all your favorite sea creatures and fresh clams as well. Fantastic flavor and consistency.

Monkey Bread Pudding ($5): Monkey Bread, creamy egg custard, and warm bourbon sauce. This combines two already great treats - monkey bread and bread pudding. So scrumptious and the bourbon sauce is a wonderful touch. 

Hurricane ($9): Bacardi Light, Meyers' Dark Rum, passion fruit, fresh lime, and orange juice. A tasty, fruity slush that will make you feel like you're in the tropics.

Amazing, amazing service and it's not as busy as the Palace Station location; normally no wait time. The only instance I did wait was with a party of 6 and it was just 15 minutes. Although I love the pan roast at PS, the additional menu items offered here are great, especially the Fish and Chips and the New England Lobster Roll.

Went to the Oyster bar on Thursday, March 24; I was soooo excited because my absolute favorite Oyster Bar is at Sunset (Costa del Sol). We came right at 5 and were seated pretty quick at the bar. The chef was shucking oysters and really very nice. Waitress was a doll and of course, got busy very quickly. Brian had the fish and chips and it was really great. I ordered Shrimp Scampi, which I always got at Sunset. Not even close, I was so disappointed. The shrimp was delicious, but it was no scampi sauce. It was just chicken soup, without the chicken taste and they just dumped the oregano on it. Not good at all, I was super disappointed. I have read the previous reviews and saw that most got the Pan Roast, which is great at Sunset, too, so next time I will order that. The waitress did give our order to another customer and did not acknowledge that she had done it (although we saw it), but chef and waitress alike apologized for our long wait for the food. Brian was not happy, but I am game to try one more time because of all the great reviews. I remain optimistic. Please guys, don't let me down!
Yum!  Hear this place is better than Palace stations oyster bar!  Service was great!  Food was on point!  Wait was worth it!  Will definitely be back for more of the menu items!

Very short wait for a busy Saturday night on a holiday weekend.  Multiple servers were working the table, so it was slightly confusing but very attentive.

We started with a shrimp cocktail and half dozen Kumamoto oysters on the half shell.  Both very satisfying, shrimp well cooked, oysters briny and sweet.  

We ordered the lobster roll and combo pan roast for our mains.  Lobster roll came with super crunchy fries that were yummy.  Lobster roll was good, large pieces and not too much mayo.

Pan roast was amazing, rich full of crab, lobster and shrimp.  Heat level was four, and that seemed good just enough heat with out blowing out the other flavors. Plenty of left overs and looking forward to those today.

Over all great experience and nice to have this establishment back at the Santa Fe.

Not impressed. The seafood bar at Suncoast is waaay better as is the one  at Texas Station. We did not care for the fried fish and the New England chowder was just ok. We will not return. The atmosphere is nice,

We had the best dining experience! The staff was awesome, nice wine list and the food was delicious! The portions are huge so we were so full we had to miss dessert. Heard the desserts are great so back tomorrow just for dessert!
We've been eating here for a couple years now. And it's always a pleasure. The food is Delicious and the Staff is so very Friendly and attentive. You can't ask for more . Keep up the good work !!!

I wasn't impressed. My house pan roast did not measure up to Palace Station. My bowl was lined with oil floating in a pink liquid.  We also ordered house gumbo "10".  Not even close to Palace station which puts a habanero in the mix. It was a 5. The wait wasn't as long, but it was mediocre.

Never been to the more famous palace station location but just on a whim, came here on a week night around 8. Surprisingly there was only one other table at that time. We all ordered a different entree, and eeee served hot garlic bread. The food was pretty good. The pan roast was especially delicious, but found that the rice that came with it wasn't quite enough, so it kind of became a bisque. I ordered the gumbo, and thought that it was decent, but definitely had better elsewhere in town. We all got the spicy level 6 or 7, but there wasn't even a hint of spiciness. What was frustrating was the service. There were 2 waitresses which shouldn't be a problem. But somehow it was. We had to flag them down constantly for water etc, and in fact they were so busy chattering with other people there that I saw our dishes, after being finished and were put under the heat lamp waiting to be brought out, continued to sit there for a good 5 minutes. 

This place is very close but will we be back? Questionable. I think I wanna try the palace station next time.

Man....I would love to give this place 5 stars but....not the same as OG.  The palace pan roast is My favorite (they call it something else here) I forgot.
On looks and atmosphere AWESOME!!!  the expanded menu was great the service was great and friendly but....damn I believe these cooks /chefs need to be retrained on that one gorgeous dish.  We had the fish and chips and they were great.  It's much closer to our house and the wait is better than OG but....if I'm closer to original I rather wait in 1hour line 
I'll be back to try thier clam chowder

Yes. Finally. We've been WAITING!

We went last night, super excited. We LOVE oyster bars. And this one is super close to us. :)

The service was great. We had to wait about 15 minutes to be seated. Prep yourself for this. This is not a good place for groups as it is very small with limited seating. A group of 5 in front of us waited for about 30-45 minutes. 

We were seated at the bar. The waitress was quick to help and very attentive the entire time. 

We had:

Clam Chowder - this was super good. But it's really, REALLY thick. I dug it, but I was too full. It's good for sharing even just a cup so you save room if you order other stuff. 
Lobster roll - yes. It is SO hard to find a good lobster roll around town. This was packed full of lobster and not caked in mayonnaise. The bread they use is super good too. Light and crispy. 
Combo Pan Roast - I can't tell you how much I loved this stuff. Another really hard thing to find in Las Vegas. It was perfect! I even LOVE that they use real rice and not the precooked shit that a lot of places use. 

Only downside are the hours. They're not open for a great amount of time. Maybe it'll change...

A++ guys. I'm super happy that I don't have to go down to Palace Station and wait hours to eat. I can't wait to go again!

Reviewing the cafe inside Santa Fe Casino.  This review is for the graveyard specials inside the cafe....

They have the cheap prices....$1.99 eggs/browns/toast, $1.99 short stacks, $5.99 steak and eggs, etc etc.

But do they have the taste?  A lot of these graveyard specials are only good if you are plastered or don't know any better. 

Glad to say that it is worth the money and then some!  LOL...you would hope it would be worth the $2, but we have all been there before where food hasn't even lived up to those short expectations...

Not only are the portions fair, esp considering the prices, but the flavor is there and everything is fresh.  

Service was decent...ran dry on the drinks once or twice, but I am sure they run a thin crew midnight+.  When I requested the refill, it was there asap.

Overall, if you are looking for cheap eats, this blows away anything you are going to eat for 2-3x the price.  

Just don't be a cheap ass and tip 20% on a $2 meal please!  Your wait staff and people everywhere in town that work off tips will thank you ;)

This place is amazing.  The staff is always so nice.  The food is out of this world.  It may seem a bit pricey to some, but the portions are very big.  My husband and I get a dozen oysters then share a main dish.  Not to be cheap, but because it is PLENTY of food.  We pick a different dish each time so we can try them all.  Highly recommend this place if you are up this way!

Went there for dinner on Wed.  March 22. at 5:45 Pm. There we  about 20 people waiting. for 45 minutes no one was seated. What poor management.  The place was almost empty, and no one there attempted to seat anyone.  see my pics on facebook.

We are so glad that Santa Fe finally decided to get a oyster bar.   We waited in line for a hour but it was worth the wait.   We got the oysters, gumbo and the pan roast.  Everything was amazing.   The service was great too...   They should add a couple more tables tho as the wait wasn't needed.  (This is now a update). Came here now for my 42 bday with wife, son, mom and step-dad.  This time we don't have to wait as they've added more chairs and tables.  Once again the food wand service was great.  We had 4 dozen diff oysters, the pan roast (best ever), mac/cheese and we all shared a dessert afterwards.  Everything was amazing.  The $198 bill was appropriate for the food and amount of drinks we got.  

WE WILL DEF BE BACK!

The service was excellent we had Emily as our server. She was very pleasant and attentive. We ordered half a dozen Gold band Oysters and a Lump Crab Cocktail and two entrees. My dish was the Crab pan roast and it was loaded with shells the taste was great but I kept crunching down on shells. My husband had the Gumbo it looked like spanish rice and seafood. Overall great service food could use some attention.

The food is excellent, service was great. It is a bit pricey, but it's worth it. My only complaint, and the reason I docked a star: the food is better at the Oyster Bar in Texas Station. Also, this location doesn't have oysters Rockefeller.

Glad there is finally another great tasting oyster bar minus the 2 hour wait! This Oyster Bar at Santa Fe is just as tasty as the one at Palace Station. The staff is SUPER FRIENDLY and had no problem holding the entire bar seating area to accommodate our entire party! (Sorry for the folks that wanted to sit at the bar but were turned down because the seats were reserved for us). Complimentary bread and butter is also given.
