Prices are reasonable and there was no charge for a shared plate. Great variety of tasty oysters as well! Staff did inform us that management is working on expanding their hours.

Had the pleasure of being served by Kate and Emily, along with Chef Al! They were all AWESOME! Keep up the great work!

Dined here this evening with my daughter. We arrived a few minutes before it opened and were seated promptly at the counter as requested. Our waitress was very attentive and polite. She took our order right away and brought back 2 sourdough rolls with butter. We didn't receive any bread plates, nonetheless we just ate the bread over our napkins. I noticed the pan roast I used to order changed. It used to have crab, shrimp, and lobster. Now it also includes chicken (mostly) and andouille sausage. The basic makeup of the dish changed too. Gone is the silky cream tomato base, instead it's more of a concentrated broth now. I even watched the 1 cook prepare it by taking scoops out of what looked like a big metal tub stored in the fridge. When eating the pan roast I noticed a gelatinous mass in my mouth. It was like eating chicken noodle soup from a can that wasn't diluted with water. My daughter ordered the clam chowder and it was just ok, nothing special and not particularly fresh. The meal with 2 drinks cost $40 plus tip. Not really worth it in my opinion. 

It's almost as if they understaff the place on purpose. It was very slow getting our food  when we were the 2nd table that ordered. There was one chef and one (hot) guy shucking oysters. The guy at the bar next to us literally got up and walked out after ordering and waiting for so long. Why set yourself up for failure? Hire a couple more people for dinner service!

Really great place. Love this location quick service and food is great giving it a 4 stars only. Cause they have changed a few things. I always get the house gumbo but they have changed the complementary bread "Yuck" and then I think they changed the sausage inside of my gumbo it looked and tasted like hot dogs!!!!! They say then hadn't changed it though

Just stupid good I forgot to take a pic of the food but I got the seafood jambalaya at a level 5 heat and can I say perfect everything was perfectly cooked nothing over or under done. The oyster shooters hit the spot just right and such fresh oysters it was krazy. We sat at the bar and it got packed quick but the service was on point. The chef went around and talked when it slowed down. Amazing if ur in the area stop by I got my fix.

The food is AMAZING! The service on the other hand, terrible. No one comes to greet you, they all see you standing there but no one bothers to come up to you. They had empty tables with food on them which no one bothered to clean, instead kept walking past them as a line was formed waiting to be seated. The blonde server behind the bar kept playing with her hair. They yell at you from behind the bar to ask where you want to be seated. It took 20 mins after we were complete eating out meal before I had to get up and get a server to bring over our check. I say, order out or be prepared for terrible service
Rude didn't even get a propper greeting.  Called ahaed to see what time they close and I've got here an hour before they was closing and just was rude , best oyster bar is Texas station

Mmmm!! Dinner was soooo good. We came here in a Friday night around 7pm. Didn't have to wait in line sat right away. It was busy already took a few minutes to get our main courses but the food was really good. Flavorful & fresh! We had bread to eat while we waited and had a New England Clam chowder bowl to share before our entrees. The portions are BIG. We probably should have shared tbh. I ordered the Shrimp Linguine In White Sauce, my bf ordered the shrimp platter (fries were soggy). But I would definitely come back to try their other items. P.S. they don't have lobster rolls or lobster bisque soup (other yelpers posted pics...VERY old) lol.

Waited forever to be seated and forever to get our check at the end. The food was okay but the menu has slim pickings compared to the other Oyster Bar. Unfortunately ever Oyster Bar I have been to has had bad service.
This has to be the most convenient location to get good quality  seafood. The oysters are always fresh and the staff is amazing.

I never knew what pan roast was until I saw a Yelp Talk thread about it a few years back.  Pan roast is not roast beef nor is it any type of meat roasted in a pan, which I assumed it was by the name.  No, pan roast is actually a tomato-based soup/stew with either crab, shrimp, lobster or all three in combination.  The pan roast at the Palace Station Oyster Bar also has a secret ingredient that makes otherwise sensible folks wait in long lines just to get some.  The b/f and I have waited in said lines for our fix and talked to out-of-towners who specifically stay at the Palace Station so they can get pan roast around the clock while they visit.  We haven't had pan roast in a while because no one has time to wait in line these days, but then Santa Fe Station opened their own Oyster Bar, which is much closer to us than Palace Station. 
 
Throwing caution to the wind, we ventured over on Friday night around 6:40pm and the line didn't look too awful compared to what we've experienced at Palace Station's bar.  Timing our wait, we were seated in about 40 minutes at the bar and we considered that a win.  This Oyster Bar also has a few tables, thus more seating room, but I usually prefer sitting at the bar at most places for the view of the action behind it.  We got to watch the huge oysters being shucked by one of the staff the whole time we were there and it sure looked like a workout!  
This time the b/f and I shared the combo pan roast with shrimp, lobster, and crab since we decided that our past forays to the Oyster Bar where we each got a bowl was too much and bulking season has to end sometime. Plus we also shared a bowl of clam chowder, Mel had oysters, and I had a Moscow Mule, so maybe the bulk isn't over.  Anyway, the pan roast was just as good as Palace's to me with even more lobster, crab, and shrimp.  The clam chowder came after the pan roast because our waitress forgot we ordered it, but she was very apologetic and comped it because of the oversight; the chowder was great, too.  The only disappointment was the bread they serve since they're basically toasted hot dog buns, not bread rolls.  We will definitely return to this Oyster Bar from now on for our pan roast fix.

This location is the same company as the one at PALACE STATION but the food is not as good. The oyster bar at palace station is probably my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas but I hate the 1-2 hour wait while watching everyone else eat. So the idea of an oyster bar with no line sounds amazing to me. This place is located at the Sante Fe and yes there was no line when I came. They have more bar seating and even a few tables. First thing I noticed is the chefs do not cook the food in front you of like at palace station, there's a barrier between the people sitting at the bar seats and the stove. Food here just did not taste the same. I may be biased because I compared this to the same food as palace station, but if you're the same restaurant, wouldn't the food also taste the same? Also, the service here was very slow. I just did not feel like a priority and probably waited at least 20-25 minutes just to pay my check. Overall, this place is okay but I rather wait in line at palace station for some on toast than go here.

The wait is a hit or miss. If you are lucky there is no line and get to be seated in seconds. I hear the Oyster bar in palace station is usually the longest wait (at least an hour).
My husband and I are regulars and we have tried everything on the menu. The main cheff is AL. He really loves what he does. Last time we went, which was about two days ago, AL had help from another cheff, but I think AL puts his touches to the food better. 
My favorite oyster would have to be the Stellar. I love the mussel steamers with the lemon, garlic, butter sauce umm! The pan roast is awesome. The shrimp scampi could have a little more flavor. The fish and chip are very good. Clam chowder is the best in town. We really enjoy our meals here!
I will take pictures and upload them on my next trip to the bar.

Horrible experience with the  chef sunday.   He didn't make it a spice level #8  which ok own up to it instead he keeps telling me he's a "chef, not a cook,"  he was a complete obnoxious person towards me, the server came and apologized saying, "he's been an ass all day I'm so sorry," There was no spice in my pan roast, no red pepper nothing. I don't ever want anything for free, i paid $30 after tip for a to go order.  He embarrassed me and yelled "do you want habanero in there too."  being a complete smart ass. I've been there many times before, and it wasn't this chef. So rude he made my eyes tear up, wth   what kind of place makes a customer cry over spices. If you have a bad day no need to take it out on customers seriously this isn't McDonald's treat me with respect! Im purchasing a $30 dollar dish not a $3.99 one!   Top it off they had me wait 50 minutes for my to go order.  We were in the casino came back, and had no clue about our order.    When i called the oyster bar to say food wasn't #8 spicy level the lady on the phone said mam we have no to go orders spicy level 8 that have been placed. Which obviously i had placed one and recieved it with no spice! Ridiculous  then the chef wants to come out all rude when i come to ask for my level #8!. I hate writing reviews i never do!

I tried this Oyster Bar when they first opened and didn't really enjoy it, but thought that since they just opened they were working out the kinks of a new restaurant!  Gave it another try recently...the staff were friendly and knowledgeable.  They didn't seem to have a designated hostess so you had to wait until one of the waitresses were free to seat you!   I ordered the clam chowder and the combo pan roast.  The clam chowder was pretty good but the pan roast was a disappointment!  I ordered a 7 out of 10 on the spicy level but it didn't have any heat at all!  I've ordered a 5 at the other places and they were pretty spicy...The pan roast wasn't all that creamy and the taste was so so!  They need to work on giving a quality pan roast for the price they charge you.  Palace Station is #1 even with the hour long wait!

We waited in line for one hour, but it was well worth it! Everything was delicious. We had the French Kiss oysters, clam steamers, NE clam chowder, shrimp pan roast, and linguine and clams. Our waitress, Corey, was awesome as well. Will definitely come back!

I have been excited to try this place for the fish and chips.    $21.00 seemed pricy but if it was good then why not.   What a let down.   The fish was dry and rubbery, very bland.   The fries had a good seasoning and were very good.   I will go back but not for the fish.   Everything else looked and smelled amazing so we will go for that.   It is very clean, an unexpected location very close to our home.
